articles.title: Moves to Seek Passage of "Alternative Bill on NSL" under Fire
Results of S. Korean Authorities' Unreasonable Negotiations on Rice Flailed
articles.content:
Moves to Seek Passage of "Alternative Bill on NSL" under Fire 
    Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- 14 leading members of the Uri Party in a statement on December 30 denounced the negotiations between the ruling and opposition parties on the issue of abolishing the "National Security Law" (NSL), according to south Korean MBC.
 Accusing the Uri Party and the Grand National Party of working hard to pass the alternative bill on the NSL in collusion, the statement said this is nothing but a political charade aimed at instituting another evil law.    
 If those parties railroad the "alternative bill" through the National Assembly, it will be so shameless an act as betraying the history and going against even the most elementary etiquette towards human beings, the statement noted.
